utterance.speaker: EMCEE
utterance.content: Our guest tonight has a remarkable story. At age 22, Alice Clark journeyed to the jungles of Rwanda, where she studied the mighty silverback gorilla.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Alice, they’re about to begin. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: EMCEE
utterance.content: When she returned to America, Ms. Clark applied her extensive research on dominate primates to the alphas of our urban jungle, advising some of the world’s most prominent leaders and their spouses, which inspired her latest non-fiction best-seller, Mating Rituals: A Field Guide to Relationships. Please welcome Alice Clark.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: C’mon, c’mon, c’mon.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. I’m just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s like he’s staring at me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? What do you mean? Linus?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Whenever I come over here it feels like he’s watching me. Do you even notice how his eyes follow you when you move?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I love that. It keeps you on alert.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, Castle, I’m a cop. I’m always on alert. When I come home I just want to relax. Not fall asleep staring into the eyes of a hungry lion about to pounce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You’re not uh … you’re not asking me to get rid of Linus, are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I was – I was just thinking that maybe you could move it to another room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Another room?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like um – – maybe your office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My office?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Yes, okay. We’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s been a murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of Linus’s feelings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just, I bought Linus with my first royalty check from In a Hail of Bullets. He’s my totem. Wild and untamed - and my bedroom is my lair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know, Castle, but isn't it kind of our lair now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Linus the lion is part of my identity. You don’t want to strip me of my identity, do you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. You know what? You’re right. I’m sorry. Um … I could just stay at my own place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. Wait, no. That’s not –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Ryan, what’ve we got?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Victim is Alice Amy Clark, 37, GSW to the chest. A parking attendant found her an hour ago. Apparently she’s some sort of therapist. Has an office here in the building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, Alice Clark? Not the Alice Clark, relationship guru to the rich and famous? Author of Mating Rituals: A Field Guide to Relationships?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By reputation only. She has the idea that we can improve our relationships by channeling our animal nature. Um … the instinct to protect and nurture, for example. By say, offering to share one’s lair.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Well, speaking of animal nature, you should see the inside of her car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, wow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s been completely torn apart.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: And from the spatter pattern it looks like all of this was done after she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So they killed her then they killed her car?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So they were looking for something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, and it wasn’t her wallet, phone, or keys, either. The killer didn’t bother with those, or the ten grand that we found inside her purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a lot of walking around money – even for a bestselling author.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if they weren’t after the money what were they looking for? When did this happen?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on body temp and lividity I’d say between 6 and 10 last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a look at security cams?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Garage doesn’t have camera coverage, but other parts of the building do. They’re pulling tape for us right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody calling her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, it’s some kind of reminder alarm. It keeps going off every few minutes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito’s with her assistant upstairs. He might know.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I don’t know anything about it, but I left the office about 4:30 to help set up. When she didn’t show I knew something was wrong.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was she expecting anyone after you left? Any appointments?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: No. In fact, she had me cancel the one for yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any reason?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I assumed she wanted time to prep for the lecture. She spent most of the day in her office. The only calls she took were from her boyfriend, Matt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did she mention having anything of value on her? Something someone might have been looking for?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: No. Why do you ask?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The whole place was turned inside out, just like the car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was taken?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing valuable. Computers, artwork, iPads – all the obvious stuff was all there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what were they looking for?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. The assistant said that they went through her client files. Alice counseled some serious VIPs. CEOs, politicians, generals. And she took very detailed notes of every session.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The most intimate details of the world’s elite? People have been killed for less.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are there any files missing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the assistant is combing through them now, but it’s going to take some time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, so I scrubbed her building’s security video and check this out. This guy went up to Alice’s office floor near the tail end of our time of death window. And he was the only person up there last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means he’s the only person who could have tossed Alice’s place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And check it out, he’s turned away from the camera in every shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hiding his face from us. This is our guy.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective? Your victim’s boyfriend is here.

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: No. Never seen him before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you have no idea what he might have been looking for?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: This is my fault. I was supposed to pick her up last night but I got held up at work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is it that you work, exactly?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: I’m a consultant for an international aid NGO. All she did was help people. Why would anyone want to kill her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did she seem to you lately? Was there anything to indicate she was having any troubles in her life?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: No, nothing. She seemed happy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how about her clients? Was she having difficulty with anyone?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Sometimes. Um, the people she counseled could be aggressive. Demanding. But she liked the challenge. Taming the wild beast and all that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anyone stand out in particular?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Alice was discreet about her work. Though, at lunch the other day she seemed a little rattled. She said she received a call from a pissed off client.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she say who?

utterance.speaker: MATT
utterance.content: Like I said, she was discreet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Listen to this. “Males in both species define their territory then honor the female by inviting them in.” See? I’m – I’m honoring you by inviting you into my territory. And Linus is part of that territory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if you want to be invited into my territory again you should probably rethink that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So CSU just finished with the car and the office and they found no prints and almost no trace evidence. It’s like both locations have been cleaned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That and the cameras? This guy’s a pro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so why would a professional assassin murder a therapist?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because as a therapist she’d be privy to her clients deepest, darkest secrets. Secrets so explosive simply hearing them ensured her demise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, what kind of secrets?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well – – nuclear launch codes, that the moon launch was a fake, that Roswell wasn’t. Secret location of the cryogenically frozen body of Walt –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, um … boyfriend checks out. Called his office. They verified that he was working all last night. But Alice definitely tumbled down the rabbit hole to shadyland. That alert on her phone, NF1945? It’s the tail number of a private jet that she chartered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She chartered a private jet? To where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well I contacted the pilot out of Teterboro, he said that Alice paid him $50 grand in cash to be on standby with a full tank of gas, destination unknown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She knew she was in trouble. She was getting ready to disappear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, she’s a best-selling author with a flourishing career. If she was in trouble why didn’t she just call the police or her boyfriend? Why would she charter a jet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys. We got something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The canvass turned up a news vendor who saw our suspect leave Alice’s building and drive off in the blue van. The reason he remembers our guy is because his van was parked behind a woman who was cursing out a parking office for giving her a ticket.

utterance.speaker: TECH AGENT TORI
utterance.content: Luckily traffic enforcement vehicles are mounted with cameras that snap photos of each parked car. It’s how they catch meter cheaters. Here’s the ticketed car, and here’s your murder suspect’s blue van.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s registered to a Manhattan Raptor Inc.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get an address?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hands! Show me your hands!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey! Go around back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Open up!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me see those hands!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I said show me those hands!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He didn’t have an ID on hi or in his van, but we did find an interesting match on his fingerprints.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s Barrett Hawke?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Barrett Hawke? As in the legendary fixer? He’s been sweeping the dirt of New York’s rich and famous under the rug for over a decade. Not my dirt. I just – heard.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve heard, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Word is he does what it takes to get the job done. He’s teflon. Nothing ever sticks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s because he’s careful. Every memory drive in his van was wiped clean. There’s nothing to tie him back to Alice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t care how careful he is. Someone hired him to kill her. This time he’s not walking away.

utterance.speaker: BARRETT HAWKE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective. I’ve never seen this woman before in my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even though my colleagues witnessed you in the back of your van shredding her photo.

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Your colleagues were mistaken. But that was a micro cut shredder, so unfortunately there’s no proof either way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can place you in her office building on 77th Street at the time of her murder. So if you didn’t know Alice Clark, what the hell were you doing there?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: My favorite shoeshine guy’s in that building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. On the 9th floor? Right down the hall from her ransacked office?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Hm. Can’t really make out his face. Hard to say who that guy is. C’mon, Detective. What do you really have on me, huh? Do you have a single piece of evidence that I was in her office? Or that I was involved in her death? Prints? DNA? Anything? That’s what I thought.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just like she said. Teflon.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The only way to nail this man is figure out who hired him. And for that we need to know what Barrett Hawke was sent to find.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I’ve been through just about everything. Her research notes, her book files, everything’s intact. I’ve rechecked it a couple of times against our index files and there’s only one thing missing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: A client file.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which client?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Andrew and Monica Spencer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Andrew Spencer, the hotel and real estate tycoon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who would want his file?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Actually, I think Andrew Spencer wanted it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would he want his own file.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Because … well, it’s not public knowledge yet, but the Spencers are getting a divorce. And last week Mrs. Spencer’s attorney subpoenaed Alice to turn all of her session notes over to the court.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Andrew Spencer’s worth billions. If there was any compromising information in those notes it would cost him boatloads in a settlement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, doesn’t state law protect therapist-client privacy?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Except Alice wasn’t a licensed therapist. She was more of a relationship coach. When Mr. Spencer found out the sessions weren’t privileged he hit the roof He threatened to sue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well it looks like he did more than just sue.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know where we can find him?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Mr. Spencer will be right with you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ve got to hand it to this Alice chick, bro. Whatever her monkey theory is has her in with the movers and the shakers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She learned from the real gorillas. Seems to be working with the eight hundred ones in the human world. She was like the dog whisperer for CEOs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You really buy that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, skimmed through her book. I think there might be something to her theory. For instance, she said that in every relationship there needs to be a masculine energy and a feminine energy. Even in ours.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. Well, we know which one you are.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know about you, but I am very comfortable in my masculinity.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You do realize you’re wearing a sweater vest, right?

utterance.speaker: ANDREW SPENCER
utterance.content: It better be important. I just hung up on my investment group in Singapore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Andrew Spencer, Detective Esposito –

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: I don’t give a rat’s ass who you are. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Alice Clark. You know her?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: Yeah, I know her. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, she had a client file of you and your soon to be ex-wife, Monica. A file that’s currently missing.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. Did my wife’s attorney put you up to this? You know what this is? This is harassment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, Mr. Spencer. This is a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: A murder investigation? Who’s dead?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Alice.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: Alice is dead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon Spencer. Drop the act. We know you hired Barrett Hawke to kill her and steal the files.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ve already linked him to our murder.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: No, no, no. Wait, wait, wait. That had nothing to do with me. Look, I have heard of Hawke. But I’ve never used his services. Hell, I wouldn’t even know how to find the guy. And yes, I wanted the file. But Alice gave it to me. She brought it to me herself. I – I have witnesses.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would Alice give it to you?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: I reminded my wife that those sessions contained plenty of statements that she wouldn’t want in the public record, either. She agreed and we both called Alice. Alice understood our need for privacy, so she offered to turn it over in exchange for a favor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? What kind of favor?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: It was actually strange. She said she needed a room in one of my hotels for a couple of days. And I had to promise there would be no record that she was ever there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alice dropped fifty grand to charter a plane but she needed Spencer to comp the hotel room for her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s because it wasn’t about the money. It was about the anonymity. She even told the front desk that she didn’t want housekeeping in her room. And she didn’t tell her boyfriend where she was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not that she would need housekeeping. There’s no luggage here; nothing in the bathroom. It’s like she was never even here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but she checked in yesterday morning. Castle, what if this was a safe house? What if she knew that Hawke was after her and she decided to hide out here until she could flee the country?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With a plane standing by? What was she waiting for? No, no, no, no. Something is going on here. There’s a reason why she got this room and she didn’t want anyone to know about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. The safe is locked. She got it to hide something. Come take a look. I bet whatever Hawke was after, it’s in there. A place she knew it would safe and knew no one would think to look for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means it’s still in there. Is there an override code?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever’s in there, that’s the reason why she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this must be worth millions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tens of millions. Looks like diamonds were our girl’s best friend.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve never seen anything like this outside of a museum. Are you sure it’s real?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We stopped at a jewelers on the way back and he almost had a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It has to be what Hawke was after, but – what was Alice doing with it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Given the cash, the hotel, and the private plane I’d say she was making a getaway.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Are you saying she stole it? A trusted therapist to A-list clientele. She was in the perfect position to work her way inside. She’s Ocean’s Eleven … minus ten. She’s … Ocean’s one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe it’s Ocean’s none. I mean, Alice was successful. She’s respected. She’s at the top of her game. Why would she risk it all by stealing a diamond?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which … brings up another problem. I spoke to the boys in robbery and at the FBI. No one has reported a diamond like this stolen. Not just recently. Ever.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then where did it come from?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if it was stolen why haven’t the owners reported it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if it’s because they couldn’t afford to? Because the diamond has some kind of sordid past. Perhaps it’s like the Hope Diamond, it’s cursed. Or maybe it’s a – an occult gem. It has great power, smuggled out of Nazi Germany shoved up some –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thank you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone knows where it came from. Someone sent Barrett Hawke after Alice to get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the diamond could tell us.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you said it yourself. You’ve never seen anything like this outside a museum. Diamonds this big are famous. They have names. The Akbar Shah, the Angola Star, the um … Excelsior. No, this diamond has a story. If we can figure out what that story is it might just give us a path to our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Castle’s right. This city is the hub of the nation’s diamond trade. There has to be an expert out there that can tell us where it came from.

utterance.speaker: EDWARD PETERS
utterance.content: Such beauty. Absolutely stunning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you tell where it came from?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: Diamonds are not people, Detective. A diamond mine in Asia looks the same a diamond mine in Africa. But there are no diamond mines in America, so it is not from here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, what my partner means is, have you come across this stone before?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: Ah, never. And as head of the American Gemological Foundation I know every extraordinary stone on the planet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you don’t know who owns it?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: No. And I should. I mean, the discovery of an incredible gem like this it headline making. It becomes famous.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … could it be a recent import?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: I’m current on gem reports that passed through customs and nothing remotely this size has come through in my entire tenure at the AGF. No, the origins of this stone are a complete mystery. Could you tell me how you came to possess it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s evidence in an ongoing investigation, so …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What can you tell us about this diamond?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: Well, I should like to run additional spectrometer imaging tests on it, but for the meantime let me start with the four C’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, color, cut, clarity, carat. You’d know this if you’d ever bought an engagement ring.

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: The diamond is colorless. No blemishes and pristine cut. No internal clouding. And uh .. … nearly one hundred carats.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man. Hey, how deep would my pockets have to be to afford a rock like that?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: Detective, you are not tall enough to have pockets deep enough. But I would say it’s worth … $60 million. Conservatively.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I ain’t that tall.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Six zero, like with another six zeros after that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That would be $60 million, yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it possible it’s an heirloom passed down through generations and that’s why there’s no record of it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah. Peters said that old school cutters fashioned diamonds with sharp edges. This one has smooth edges, which it means it had to be cut within the last few decades.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And no customs declaration means it was smuggled in, probably from the country where it was mined.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Were we able to connect any of Alice’s clients to the diamond?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re still going through them, but no, not yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Peters also said he found some glue residue on the stone, which suggests that it was set in a piece of jewelry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For engaged men everywhere I can only hope it wasn’t a ring.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Get that rock back to the precinct. I want it under locked key and armed guard.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re on our way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So … we thinking the same thing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That it’s a bummer we can’t stop for lunch because there’s a sixty million dollar diamond sitting between us?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. That because of the $60 million dollar diamond sitting between us that we are not-really-but-kinda-sorta thinking about making a run for the border.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hadn’t even crossed my mind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Of course it didn’t. Nope, you wouldn’t have the stones. All I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You breathing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, for now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gun! Get down!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The diamond!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Subway, seven o’clock. I’ll cover. Go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m good.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The SUV took off right after you hit the subway. We’re pulling traffic footage and we’ve got every cop in the city looking for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you said they were wearing masks?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Clown masks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As if clowns weren’t creepy enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about their voices? Did they say anything? Did they accents?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … they let their bullets do the talking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain, they attacked us in broad daylight. They knew we had the rock. Now either Barrett Hawke has gone commando all of a sudden or something else is going on here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s right. I mean, this is starting to sound like it’s about a whole lot more than just a diamond.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay. Get cleaned up. I need you two to go hunting for that SUV. Whatever’s going on, Alice was in it up to her eyeballs. If any of her clients have even the remotest connection to a country that produces diamonds, I want to know about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I was thinking. When we work a case together this desk of yours is sort of – kind of – our space. And these elephants on parade have creeped me out since day one. So what do you say we just get rid of these? Oh, do you have a problem with that? If I try to get rid of something that obviously has deep meaning to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you don’t like the elephants, I don’t like the elephants.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. I actually like those elephants. They obviously have family values and this one’s good with money. Anyway … … any luck on Alice’s clients.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, a couple of possibilities. A hedge fund manager with investments in South Africa. A UN diplomat with ties to Russia. And a CEO with a manufacturing plant 80 miles from a Chinese mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder if we’re looking at this wrong. What if it’s not about Alice’s clients but it’s actually about Alice?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When she was living with the gorillas in Africa that was in Rwanda, right along the border of the Congo, a region known for conflict diamonds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you think she was involved in the blood diamond trade?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think it’s a story that writes itself. A young primatologist in an unstable region falls for a different kind of gorilla. A warlord who is funding his agenda with diamonds. He gives her one, as a gift. No, no, go back. She’s not that into him and she steals the diamond, having no idea its real value. She smuggles it back to the United States and finds she can’t sell it without attracting too much attention, so she hides it. Until one day the jilted, and well-read, warlord finds a book and sees her photo on the back. Knowing what she stole, he comes after her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That … is … surprisingly plausible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right? It’s actually – that would actually explain a lot. Why she was planning to disappear, why Esposito and Ryan were shot at in broad daylight. That’s actually a perfect theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe, Castle, but I might have a better one. What do you know about Steve Warner?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … tech entrepreneur.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Apparently he and his wife were Alice’s clients.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what, they had business contacts in diamond producing countries?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but their charitable foundation does. Primarily in Africa. “Delivering immunizations to developing war-torn countries.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but what makes your heroic philanthropist story better than my crazed warlord story?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This. That’s Steve and Janet Warner at the Amnesty Global benefit two nights ago. Janet’s on their board. You recognize anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. and Mrs. Warner, thank you so much for coming.

utterance.speaker: STEVE WARNER
utterance.content: Of course. We can’t tell you how shocked we were to hear about Alice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long had you two been her clients?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: A couple of years.

utterance.speaker: JANET WARNER
utterance.content: She saved our marriage. Being a power couple isn’t easy. Alice understood that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just curious, when the two of you would meet with Alice would the two of you go to her office or would she come to your home?

utterance.speaker: JANET
utterance.content: Both. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she ever have access to your place? Did you ever give her keys or security codes?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: No. Why would we? What’s this all about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe her murder is connected to a theft.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: A theft?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, a rather significant one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either of you notice anything missing?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Warner, that is your diamond. All one hundred carats of it. It was found in Alice’s possession. Any idea how she got it?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: I think there’s been a mistake. This isn’t ours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not?

utterance.speaker: JANET
utterance.content: I’ve never seen that stone before in my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Well, you were wearing it the other night.

utterance.speaker: JANET
utterance.content: Oh, I see the confusion. The stone in my necklace, that’s not a diamond. It’s a costume piece. It’s just crystal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crystal? Mrs. Warner, that is the same stone.

utterance.speaker: JANET
utterance.content: Detective, you’re mistaken. They only look similar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then I suppose you won’t mind if we send one of our detectives home with you to look at it. Just to be sure.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: I think we’re done here. If you have any more questions you can direct them to my attorneys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course they’re lying, but the real question is, why are they lying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, given their net worth better to take a $60 million dollar loss than be connected with a dead body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No Castle, it’s more than that. If they knew that Alice stole that diamond they should have gone to the cops. But they didn’t. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably because if they did that would mean having to reveal where the diamond came from. There’s gotta be a reason why no one’s heard of it. And it must be a nefarious one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means they would do anything outside of going to the cops to get it back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You may be right. A uniform just talked to the doorman at the Warner’s building in Tribeca. He says he buzzed Hawke up to their penthouse yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Alice was killed last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like New York’s famous fixer is in a bit of a fix.

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: So I visited friends in Tribeca. That doesn’t prove anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why were you at the Warners.

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: I needed to use their bathroom. Are we really going to dance this dance again? Because I’ve got better things to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sit down. Now, Mr. Hawke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not walking away from this one. I’ve connected you to the Warners, the Warners to the stone, the stone to the dead girl, and the dead girl back to you. And then there’s also the matter of the armed assault on two NYPD detectives.

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: I did not kill Alice Clark and I had nothing to do with any assault.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then who did?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Turn off the mic.

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: My business is discretion, so none of this is on the record, do you follow? Yes, the Warners hired me to find the diamond. That’s it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it was you? In her office, in the car?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Yeah. Looking for the stone. But Alice was already dead when I got there. I do things Detective, questionable things, but I don’t kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. So then who attacked my colleagues?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Wasn’t me, wasn’t the Warners. Maybe somebody else was looking for the diamond.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did you know Alice stole it?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Because when the Warners described the mugging I could tell it was an inside job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Warners were mugged?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Two nights ago. And it wasn’t random. The mugger knew exactly when and where they were gonna be. So did Alice. Not only that, but Janet told Alice about the diamond in one of their sessions. Apparently hardly anyone else knew that the diamond was real. I figured Alice had to be involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so if the Warners were mugged, why wouldn’t they just go to the police?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: They wanted to keep it quiet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I need you to tell me everything you know about that mugging. Where were they when it happened?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: Well, they were walking home from the Amnesty benefit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did Alice put it off?

utterance.speaker: HAWKE
utterance.content: She didn’t. The Warners said the mugger wore a ski mask but was definitely male.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Alice had an accomplice?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Hawke’s telling the truth then there’s another player involved. Someone who knew that the diamond was real and used Alice to get it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do you think Alice was under duress? That someone was forcing her to help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Threatening to kill her? It would explain why she did it. And why she was trying to disappear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. We got a hit on our clown car. Uniforms found it abandoned by the East River.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: SUV’s been bleached and torched. CSU’s scouring it for clues but it seems like it was a high level job. And Tori has something on the mugging.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Okay, now according to Hawke the mugger snatched the necklace at 11 o’clock on 52nd Street and bolted south on 8th. Unfortunately there are no street or security cams in the vicinity. But a 911 call came in two minutes later form 49th and 8th, three blocks away.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: 911, what’s your emergency?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: There’s been a hit and run.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: What’s your location? I’ll send an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: No, you don’t understand. I hit someone and he ran.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: He ran?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, a man dressed all in black, wearing a ski mask. He came out of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s gotta be our guy. Get over there. Get a full description.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: I can still hear the sound of his body going thunk on my hood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you remember what he looked like?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: No. The whole thing was a blur. Just that God awful sound. He hit so hard he left a dent. But when I got out of my car he just pushed himself off and ran down 49th. Here, I’ll show you. His hands were up like this, and then –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. I’ll call CSU.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ryan here.

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: Detective, Edward Peters here. I believe I have new insight into your diamond. After reviewing test results on the stone, my colleagues and I all reached the same conclusion.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: The diamond is flawless. Flawless beyond anything nature could create.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you saying it’s fake?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: No, it’s composed of carbon and entirely real. But it is man-made.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa … whoa, what are you saying, man-made?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: There have long been industrially produced diamonds, carbon under heat and pressure mimicking nature in a lab. But typically the stones are small or of inferior quality.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So … it’s not worth $60 million?

utterance.speaker: PETERS
utterance.content: No. It’s actually worth infinitely more. In fact, it’s priceless.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Priceless?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Priceless?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Apparently a stone of that size and quality, it’s the holy grail of diamond manufacturing, considered by most to be impossible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where did the Warners get it? And why are they denying its existence?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know who wanted it. And who attacked you boys. A diamond like that, made in a lab? That would put diamond companies out of business.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think it’s the diamond industry who sent in the clowns?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With the future of their industry at stake? Who knows how far they’d go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys? Tori got a hit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So CSU was able to pull a usable print?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, luck for us the lady wasn’t big into washing her car.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: When I ran the print nothing popped in the federal database.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But given the international nature of the diamond industry I asked Tori to cast a wider net. We contacted Interpol.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our mugger’s a foreign national?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: South African, to be exact. His name is Leo Wyngaard. In and out of half a dozen African prisons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not to mention he’s on the terror watch list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just the kind of guy a diamond cartel would hire for their dirty work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Now show them the picture.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Matt Lanchet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alice’s boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They almost missed him at JFK. He was boarding a flight to Johannesburg.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He must have cut his losses once he knew we had secured the diamond.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I still don’t get why the Warners had a man-made stone in the first place.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well whatever the reason, Leo wanted the diamond and he used Alice to get it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe he leveraged her into helping him. Forced her to pull the money out and order up a plane.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then he killed her and made this whole thing look like it was her idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, considering that this guy tried to kill me and Espo for that diamond, mind if we go in there and get some answers?

utterance.speaker: LEO WYNGAARD
utterance.content: Wait, you think I’m working for the cartels? That I was using Alice? I loved Alice.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You always use fake names with women that you love?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: She knew who I really was. We were in this together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, sure you were. Why did you steal that diamond?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Alice and I met when I was in Rwanda doing aid work. We were young and in love. And then one day soldiers came into the village, financed by the diamond cartel. We watched from the jungle as they slaughtered everyone. Casualties of a turn war for profit. That day changed me. I dedicated myself to stopping the cartel's bloody practices. It was a life I knew Alice couldn’t be a part of, but I never stopped loving her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you’re working against the cartels by … stealing a man-made diamond?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Two years ago stones started popping up in Europe and the Middle East. Flawless and being sold for millions. That’s when a gemologist friend of mine happened across a pair of them. He discovered that they were exactly the same. Nature doesn’t make exact copies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They were man-made.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yeah. I tried to trace them back to their source. All I knew was that they were coming out of the States. And then Alice called me, out of the blue. Said one of her clients, Steve Warner, had a secret.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, are you telling me Steve Warner can make diamonds?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: Yes. Man-made diamonds are nothing new. But no one had ever produced this quality of gem before. Big and flawless. Soon diamond mines would be a relic of the past. Steve Warner’s technology could change everything. So I approached Warner. I begged him to make his technology available, but he denied he even had it. He was just using it to line his own pockets. The world needed to know and we needed proof.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The necklace.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: We knew that if we could just examine that stone that we could tie it back to the others. That we could show everyone what he was doing and they could all see that it was possible. Then … everyone would eventually unlock the code.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then all of a sudden flawless man-made diamonds would flood the market.

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: No more cartels. No more sponsored bloodshed. We were going to change the world. That night Alice had a plane standing by to take us to a private lab. But she never showed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did anyone else know that you had taken the diamond?

utterance.speaker: LEO
utterance.content: The only people that knew that diamond was gone were me, Alice, and the Warners.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: We told you, we’re not answering questions about that diamond.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s okay. There’s nothing you can say that we don’t already know. For instance, we know it’s man-made.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we know you are the man who made it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We also know that you made a lot of cash secretly selling those man-made diamonds on foreign markets.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. Do you know what I’m worth? Why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You took a huge hit during the economic downturn. You were leveraged to the hilt. You needed that cash.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Even if what you’re saying is true, that doesn’t mean I murdered Alice!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You did hire Hawke to get that diamond back.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Okay. I had to. I was afraid VonRowen would find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: VonRowen the diamond cartel? What do they have to do with this?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: When I was in engineering school I developed a process for lab grown diamonds. But all I could manage were small, flawed stones. They were worthless. At the time I had no money, so I sold the technology to the only people interested. VonRowen.

utterance.speaker: JANET
utterance.content: They wanted to stifle the competition. You know, protect their market share.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Then a few years ago Janet and I hit a rough patch and I wanted to give her something meaningful. It was too easy just to give her a diamond.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you decided to make one of your own.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: I broke out my equipment so I could make her a small diamond. But in the process I had a game changing breakthrough. My little romantic gesture became one of the biggest diamonds in history. Suddenly I could make flawless stones, as many as I wanted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With technology that now belonged to VonRowen. And when the downturn hit and you needed cash –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - you realized you had the means, as long as no one knew.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: It violated our agreement. If VonRowen found out, they’d ruin me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why you hired a strike team to recover that stone from our custody.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: What? I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Warner, we found the SUV they used. It had been torched. But CSU still was able to pull the VIN number.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out it was stolen from a garage in Queens. And the garage owner, Joseph Biancci, he’s the brother-in-law of your head of security. We also pulled phone records and found that you and he had exchanged at least half a dozen phone calls in the hours before the attack.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You ordered that strike.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: I didn’t make these calls. I wasn’t even home. It’s - … … no. Janet? What did you do?

utterance.speaker: JANET
utterance.content: What did I do? I treated her like family. I trusted her. When Hawke found out it was Alice, I went to her begging for her to give the stone back. I only meant to scare her. But she grabbed for the gun and … She would have exposed us, Steve. We were going to lose everything. I had to stop her. I had to get it back. For us. For you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Keep ‘em closed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I swear, if you’re bringing me face to face with Linus I’m going to pull my gun out and shoot him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That will not be necessary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay … open them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seashells?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, not just seashells. Those are our seashells. We collected those –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On our first walk in the Hamptons.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you kept these?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now I know it doesn’t really go with the space, but at least it won’t be hungrily staring at you in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t have to do this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I did. I did. I finished reading Alice’s book and there’s a chapter in there that speaks to couples like us. See, we’re both alphas. And it says that we need to define our shared territory together. These are pieces all over – these are all my stories. But the shells? That’s ours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I like our story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. That can’t be good. You have to admit though, we brought this upon ourselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, if you’re scared you can always sleep on my side of the bed tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
